title: Implement HttpListener Class
body: Please implement the HttpListener class so that we can run REST based controls (similar to Xbox Smartglass) for our own apps?

comments.body: And it would be nice to support HTTPS. Especially if "SSL/TLS support for StreamSocketListener" is not implemented yet and there are no clear options for developers to connect to their IoT apps securely.
I'm asking when this will hit a public SDK branch.
please don't forget the possibility to have TLS support for HttpListener...

Do you have a roadmap for this feature?   We want to deploy, as UWP desktop app, an ASP.Net Core self-hosted REST API to render Razor pages + JavaScript widgets. Now that we don't have it,  the solutions  are to have 2 different development teams  in xaml and web,  or to use Electron and   bridge or react native.  This situation  slows considerably the win10 apps adoption.
It would be nice to get the HTTP Listener API back in WinRT.   This makes for a nice easy approach to adding a REST api for remote control of an app through a browser for media players and such.
